ref: 7935 parpaṭa2; ˚ṭaka -- m., ˚ṭikā -- f. ʻ species of medicinal plants ʼ Suśr., ˚ṭī -- f. ʻ red -- flowered Oldenlandia ʼ Bhpr. [Cf. parpa -- 2 ʻ young grass ʼ lex., Pk. pappaga -- n. ʻ a partic. plant ʼ]
Pa. pappaṭaka -- m. ʻ a partic. water plant ʼ;
L. papaṛ m. ʻ the box tree Buxus sempervirens ʼ;
P. pāpṛā m. ʻ the medicinal bitter herb Fumaria parviflora ʼ, pāpṛī, pāprī f. ʻ the shrub Podophyllum emodi (with red fruit) ʼ;
bhal. pappṛi f. ʻ a small shrub (eaten by goats) ʼ;
bhal. pappṛi f. ʻ a small shrub (eaten by goats) ʼ;
Ku. pāpaṛ ʻ leaves of the sweet yam ʼ, pāpṛo m. ʻ wild yam ʼ;
N. pāpre laharā ʻ the creeper Porana racemosa with a scaly fruit ʼ (< párpaṭa -- 1?);
Or. pāpaṛi, pāmp˚ ʻ the medicinal plant Podophyllum emodi ʼ, pāpaṛā ʻ a timber tree ʼ.
